post.summary: Create Sub-company
post.description:
Attention!
If you want to create a company and assign it as an administrator of an existing user, pass the user_id parameter.
If you want to assign a new user as an administrator, pass the parameters name, email and password.
Note
* Demo companies can only create demo sub-companies! Passing the parameter inn is not necessary for them!

Parameter inn is required only if the company operates in full mode

company_name.description: The name of the new company

is_demo.description: (optional)Flag indicating that the sub-company is created in demo mode. Except demo companies.

locale.description: Short name of language (The locale that will be set to the owner of the new company)

expires_at.description: (optional)Timestamp that indicates when the company will be disabled (The absence of a parameter is equivalent to setting a NULL value)

get.summary: Get all current company sub-companies
Get Sub-company by ID (in current company)

put.description:
Note:
* The type of company can be changed, except when the sub-company is a dealer (type = dealer) and has sub-companies.
* The inn attribute can only be set when transferring a company from demo mode to full.
* Inn attribute can be changed only for companies operating in full mode (not demo)

active.description: Flag indicating that the company is active(not disabled)

is_demo.description: Used to transfer the company to full mode (Only for demo companies)

expires_at.description: (optional)Timestamp that indicates when the company will be disabled

delete.summary: Delete sub-company by id in current company
delete.description: All nested subcompanies will also be removed.

post.summary: Get all users directly associated with current company.

get.summary: Get all current users of the current company
get.description:
Attention! This method is different from '/api/company/users'
Get all current users (including those not directly related but temporarily transferred from a top-level company) of the current company

get.summary: Get current company user by id

put.summary: Update user by id in current company
put.description: You must pass at least one parameter to the method to update. Only fields for which values are passed will be updated. The current values of the remaining fields will not be affected.

active.description: (optional)Flag indicating that the user is active (confirmed and not disabled)

put.description: Allows you to log into any user-related sub-company and dive down to any level with administrative rights in the parent company

rules_belong_to_company_id.description: Unique identifier of the company on behalf of which the user acts

is_admin.description: A flag that indicates that the current user has administrator rights (direct or inherited)

put.summary: Exit from the current company to the parent company or root company
put.description:
If you pass the required parameter 'exit_point' with a value equal to the 'parent', the current user will go to the parent company of the current company.
If you pass the required parameter 'exit_point' with a value equal to the 'root', the current user will fall into his root company (the default company)

rules_belong_to_company_id.description: Unique identifier of the company on behalf of which the user acts

is_admin.description: A flag that indicates that the current user has administrator rights (direct or inherited)

put.summary: Update user by id in current company

active.description: Flag indicating that the user is active (confirmed and not disabled)

Get company statuses list

put.description:
If the company is active (enabled), it will be disabled and vice versa.
Optionally, you can pass the 'active' parameter

post.summary: Create new gateway
post.description:
Attention!
In addition to the methods described, additional query parameters may be required, which are determined depending on the selected interface!
All additional fields are determined by the rules that are specified in the rules of the interface. For example, if you request a list of interfaces through the /api/device/model/interfaces method, then the rules will be in the interfaces.rules object
Depending on the type of connection supported, a set of fields with their possible values will be specified (example of interfaces.rules.device_to_server.fields), as well as an additional set of fields in the selection_rules object, which depends on the selected value.

interface_id.description: ID of interface through which the gateway will connect to the base station/server

report_period_update.description: (optional|default=3600)The time interval(in seconds) at which data will be requested from the device
The time interval(in seconds) at which data will be requested from the device

post.summary: Create new base station

base_station_id.description: Unique identifier of base station(hardware id)

base_station_model_id.description: Unique identifier of base station model

interface_id.description: Unique identifier of the interface through which the base station interacts with other equipment

id.description: Unique identifier of base_station(In the application)

post.summary: Create new metering device
post.description:
Attention!
Devices can work either through the gateway or via the built-in modem directly with the base station/server. If the device should work through the gateway, you need to send the parameters:
* gateway_id - Gateway id
* inside_addr - Internal device address
* deviceID - Unique identifier of the device(hardware id)

interface_id.description: ID of interface through which the device will connect to the base station/gateway

gateway_id.description: (optional|only if the device works through the gateway)Unique identifier of gateway

impulse_weight.description: Impulse weight (used for calculations for impulse devices)

starting_value.description: The initial value of the pulse (used for calculations for impulse devices)

type_water_meter.description: Type of water meter. Possible value: hot,cold (Only for devices in the group 'water meter')

report_period_update.description: (optional|default=3600)The time interval(in seconds) at which data will be requested from the device

inside_addr.description: (optional|only for devices behind the gateway)Internal device address

deviceID.description: (optional|required only for devices behind the gateway)Unique identifier of the device(hardware id)

post.description: For some interfaces, you can reset the values (if you pass non-zero values)

post.summary: Get a list of device interfaces models
post.description:
You can get a list of interfaces using the following parameters(while only one is available):
* connection_type - The type of connection between devices. There are 5 types available:
'device_to_server' - from metering device to base station/server.
'device_to_gateway' - from metering device to gateway.
'gateway_to_device' - from gateway to metering device.
'gateway_to_server' - From gateway to base station/server.
'base_station' - from base station to other devices

connection_type.description:
The type of connection between devices. There are 5 types available:
1)'device_to_server' - from metering device to base station/server.
'device_to_gateway' - from metering device to gateway.
'gateway_to_device' - from gateway to metering device.
'gateway_to_server' - From gateway to base station/server.
'base_station' - from base station to other devices

post.summary: Create a task to automatically generate a report
post.description: Generate reports for different periods based on the settings of the original report

report_id.description: Unique identifier of the original report(type=string for system report)

report_period_id.description: Unique identifier of the report period

run_week_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 2)The order number of the day of the week in accordance with ISO-8601. From 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday)

run_time.description: Run time (00:00 to 23.59) in the current time zone

is_repeat.description: Flag indicating the need to repeat the task

run_date.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4 && 'is_repeat' = false)Task run date (YYYY-MM-DD date format)

valid_from.description: (optional|required only when 'is_repeat' = true)The timestamp at which the task is valid

valid_to.description: (optional|required only when 'is_repeat' = true)Timestamp at which the task is not valid

run_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4 && 'is_repeat' = true OR 'report_period_id' = 3) The sequence number of the month (1-31) in which the task should be run(the report is created). If the days in the month are greater than the specified number, the last day of the month will be used

report_period_first_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)Number of the day of the month from which you want to collect data on the report(1-31)

report_period_last_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)Number of the day of the month for which you want to collect data on the report(1-31)

report_period_difference_in_months.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)The difference between the values 'report_period_first_month_day' and report_period_last_month_day' in the number of months (0-60) (default = 0)

put.summary: Edit a task to automatically generate a report
put.description: Generate reports for different periods based on the settings of the original report

report_id.description: Unique identifier of the original report(type=string for system report)

report_period_id.description: Unique identifier of the report period

run_week_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 2)The order number of the day of the week in accordance with ISO-8601. From 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday)

run_time.description: Run time (00:00 to 23.59) in the current time zone

is_repeat.description: Flag indicating the need to repeat the task

run_date.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4 && 'is_repeat' = false)Task run date (YYYY-MM-DD date format)

valid_from.description: (optional|required only when 'is_repeat' = true)The timestamp at which the task is valid

valid_to.description: (optional|required only when 'is_repeat' = true)Timestamp at which the task is not valid

run_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4 && 'is_repeat' = true OR 'report_period_id' = 3) The sequence number of the month (1-31) in which the task should be run(the report is created). If the days in the month are greater than the specified number, the last day of the month will be used

report_period_first_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)Number of the day of the month from which you want to collect data on the report(1-31)

report_period_last_month_day.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)Number of the day of the month for which you want to collect data on the report(1-31)

report_period_difference_in_months.description: (optional|required only when 'report_period_id' = 4)The difference between the values 'report_period_first_month_day' and report_period_last_month_day' in the number of months (0-60) (default = 0)

started_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the task was started

finished_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the task was completed

user_id.description: Id of the user who created the task

poll_group_id.description: Poll group id(only command_type = poll && not exists device_ids)

gatewayID.description: deviceID of the gateway(gateway hardware id)

response_timeout.description: Response timeout from device(only command_type = raw)

direction.description: Request direction (1 to devices, 2 from device)

result_code.description: Device task log result code id

created_at.description: Device task log creation date (unix timestamp)

from.description: Number of the first entry on the page

last_page.description: The number of the last page

per_page.description: Number of records per page(number of records sent in response)

to.description: Number of the last entry on the page

total.description: Total number of records in log

is_ajax.description: Flag indicating whether the request is the result of an AJAX call

app_locale.description: Current app locale(the language that is set for the user)

options.description: List of options with rules for the service

is_system.description: Flag indicating that this service is system

is_active.description: Flag indicating that the service is active

company_id.description: The company that owns the service

name.description: Unique name of the service group

title_en.description: Title of service group in Englis

id.description: Identifier of the connection of the current company with the server

option_values.description: List of Options with Preset Values

is_active.description: Flag indicating that the service is active for current company

user_id.description: ID of the user who created the balance group

status.description: id status of the occurred event

event.description: (optional)Object with properties of the source event

devices.description: List of devices tied to the current object (example = [1,2,3])

users.description: List of users tied to the current object (example = [1,2,3])

gateways.description: List of gateways tied to the current object (example = [1,2,3])

base_stations.description: List of base stations tied to the current object (example = [1,2,3])

device_id.description: Id of the device that is tied to the accounting point

tied_direct_point_id.description: (optional|only for resource type == 1,2 and direction=2)Direction (direct=1 or reverse=2)

archived_devices.description: (optional|for single requests only)List of archive devices tied to the current accounting point (example = [1,2,3])

error_statistic.description: List of error messages for accounting point

accounting_points_profile_validated_data.description: Accounting points with validated power profile data

validation_statistics.description: List of validation statistics for accounting point

percent_deviation.description: Percent deviation between delta archive tariff and the sum of power_a_plus values

children.description: The number of elements belonging to all sub-companies of the current root company (at all levels of nesting)

all.description: The total number of elements of the current company and all its sub-companies

statistics_collected_at.description: Date for which statistics were collected(unix_timestamp)

count.description: The number of devices with which the discount starts(1-999999999)

stopDate.description: End of data collection period(date format YYYY-MM-DD)
